description: Returns information about DBProxyTarget objects. This API supports pagination.

parameters.name: DBProxyName
parameters.description: The identifier of the DBProxyTarget to describe.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as IDs. The filters supported by a describe operation are documented with the describe operation. The following actions can be filtered: DescribeDBClusterBacktracks DescribeDBClusterEndpoints DescribeDBClusters DescribeDBInstances DescribeDBRecommendations DescribeDBShardGroups DescribePendingMaintenanceActions The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved. Default: 100 Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: An arbitrary number of DBProxyTarget objects, containing details of the corresponding targets.

nested_items.name: TargetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the RDS DB instance or Aurora DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: The writer endpoint for the RDS DB instance or Aurora DB cluster.

nested_items.name: TrackedClusterId
nested_items.description: The DB cluster identifier when the target represents an Aurora DB cluster. This field is blank when the target represents an RDS DB instance.

nested_items.name: RdsResourceId
nested_items.description: The identifier representing the target. It can be the instance identifier for an RDS DB instance, or the cluster identifier for an Aurora DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port that the RDS Proxy uses to connect to the target RDS DB instance or Aurora DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Specifies the kind of database, such as an RDS DB instance or an Aurora DB cluster, that the target represents.

nested_items.name: Role
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the target of the proxy can be used for read/write or read-only operations.

nested_items.name: TargetHealth
nested_items.description: Information about the connection health of the RDS Proxy target.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the connection health lifecycle for the RDS Proxy target. The following is a typical lifecycle example for the states of an RDS Proxy target:

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the current health State of the RDS Proxy target.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the health of the RDS Proxy target. If the State is AVAILABLE, a description is not included.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.
